intro: Lepidagathis discolor, commonly known as the silverleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and Africa. It is characterized by its striking silver-green leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, which bloom throughout the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its adaptability and aesthetic appeal have contributed to its cultivation in various climates around the world.
